snippet: Dry conditions across the country, including Long Island, are worrying the botanists closely monitoring the area’s six populations of sandplain gerardia.
abstract: Montauk Journal; dry conditions are being closely monitored by botanists on the eastern end of Long Island, which holds six known populations of sandplain gerardia, New York State's only federal listed endangered plant species; only 12 known populations of the fragile wildflower exist in the entire country, all threatened by punishing drought conditions.
lead_paragraph: Dry conditions across the country, including Long Island, are worrying the botanists closely monitoring the area’s six populations of sandplain gerardia.

headline.seo: Botanists Fear Long Island Drought’s Toll on Sandplain Gerardia Flower
headline.main: Despite Protections, Botanists Fear Drought’s Toll on a Pink-Petaled Rarity
